page.title: 07EDUCATION SPECIAL SCHOOL
page.content: The Mary Hare Grammar School for the deaf is funded by a Charity Trust and fees paid by each pupil's Local Education Authority.It is a co-educational school and most of the 200 pupils aged 11-18 board there for the 4 terms.There are approx.10 pupils per class and although these low numbers limit the numbers of public exam classes available,they are necessary for the individual attention given by specially trained teachers. The desks are set in a horseshoe shape all facing the teachers,complete with sound boxes and microphones;all pupils are proficient lip readers.In the case of fire there are both fire bells and flashing lights to warn the totally deaf.The school moved to its present site in the 18 century Arlington manor house in the 1950's.Its large grounds are both woodland and parkland.
